intro: Diarrhena nekka-montana, commonly known as the mountain diadem, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical tree species. The plant is characterized by its striking white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often surrounded by a ring of leaf-like bracts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
